intro: Cattleya forbesii f. alba, commonly known as the White Cattleya, is a hybrid orchid species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with a subtle fragrance, which distinguish it from other members of the Cattleya genus. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. This variety is highly prized by orchid enthusiasts for its elegance and beauty.
